page.title: 17ASTWICK
page.content: Astwick is the smallest parish in England.It is joined with Arlesey,though is closer to Stotfold.A very picturesque hamlet it covers 665 acres,flanking the River Ivel.The A1 trunk road forms it's eastern boundary. In the past Stotfold and Astwick were separated by a marshy "no-man's-land",but now they are linked by a road.It has a church and several farms and a mill. {ASTWICK MILL. This water mill stands on the banks of the River Ivel.The structure of the mill and the millhouse as it stands today was largely built in the mid eighteenth century.The mill has an attractive garden on the banks of the river. Unfortunately the river is polluted for large stretches.
